descriptionNullable:
_____
# WHO Health Indicators for Ireland
### Prevention, Treatment and Disease Outcomes
By Humanitarian Data Exchange [[source]](https://data.world/humdata)
_____

### About this dataset
> This dataset contains an array of health indicators from Ireland taken from the World Health Organization's data portal. It covers a wide range of topics such as Mortality and Global Health Estimates, Sustainable Development Goals, Millennium Development Goals (MDGs), Health Systems, Malaria, Tuberculosis and Child health. Additionally this dataset also provides information on substance use and mental health, Injuries & violence, HIV/AIDS & STIs, Nutrition as wellas other health-related topics such as Noncommunicable diseases (NCDs), Neglected Tropical Diseases (NTD), Insecticide resistance & Oral health. Furthermore it includes information on Universal Health Coverage (UHC) and Global Observatory for eHealth (GOe) from the WHO RSUD Initiative: Governance policies and financing prevention & Treatment sectors providers. It also contains sections related to human resources along with Information systems to support youth Financial protection against AMR Glass ICD Sexual Reproductive Health etc. The different columns in this dataset consists of GHO codes & displays URL's Publishing state Year Region Country Sex Display Value Numerics Low High Standard Error Standard Deviation Comments etc to provide many perspectives on public health in Ireland over time. This data can be beneficial for analysts researchers students public policy makers activists looking for insights into the changing state of healthcare trends in Ireland . So take advantage of this resource today and explore its depths!

### More Datasets
> For more datasets, click [here](https://www.kaggle.com/thedevastator/datasets).

### Featured Notebooks
> - 🚨 **Your notebook can be here!** 🚨! 

### How to use the dataset
> 
> 
> The columns found in this dataset include codes and URLs associated with specific indicators; display names; publish state names; standard errors/deviations; start/end years and more. In addition to these columns registered users can also find numerical values associated with each indicator as well as country-specific values regarding finances or services provided by each sector of public healthcare in terms of control measures used under that particular indicator i.e treatments provided or prevention programs used etc. 
> 
> User are able to obtain complete information about each individual datapoint through its associated metadata linked within the resource descriptions on top left corner namely ‘Caveats’ section where further information such as methodology used is also listed alongside any additional comments related to that piece of information they wish to study further while using this data set.  
>   
> 
> To efficiently use this dataset one should have a basic understanding about field epidemiology - a multi-disciplinary approach similar to anthropology wherein user need acquire cross-disciplinary knowledge towards studying various population dynamics along with acquired data skillsets due course variant workflow tool usage such as R Studio while carrying out meaningful interpretation & analysis gaining maximum useful insights into subject matter rather than just relying upon single source tabular format - here zooming into comprehensive fields related data makes it visually stunning & quick dissecting process for complex datasets giving clear bird's eye view finding out underline details and trends viewed wading through macro & micro perspective visuals much faster understanding challenges ahead rapidly accruing plus deriving solutions far easier enabling rapid decision making .   
> 
> In addition user should carefully review all accompanying material published alongside facts mentioned earlier in order replace gaps arising from lack certain record stating reasons pretexting doubt replaced by known logical sound criteria accessing official documentations enhancing accuracy many folds all leading confident decision making possibly driving key timely interventions influencing policy matters at macro level eventually changing long standing norms alleviating current

### Research Ideas
> - Comparing health indicators among different countries to identify areas of improvement or focus. 
> - Measure the impact of government policies on health outcomes, by tracking changes in health indicators in a region before and after a policy change was implemented.
> - Analyzing trends over time to understand the scale and severity of a particular public health crisis such as malnutrition, infectious diseases, etc

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> [Data Source](https://data.world/humdata)
> 
>


### License
> 
> 
> See the dataset description for more information.

### Columns

**File: world-health-statistics-indicators-for-ireland-17.csv**
| Column name                        | Description                                                             |
|:-----------------------------------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **GHO (CODE)**                     | Global Health Observatory code for the indicator. (String)              |
| **GHO (DISPLAY)**                  | Display name for the indicator. (String)                                |
| **GHO (URL)**                      | URL to the indicator's metadata. (URL)                                  |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (CODE)**            | Code for the publishing state of the indicator. (String)                |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (DISPLAY)**         | Display name for the publishing state of the indicator. (String)        |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (URL)**             | URL to the publishing state of the indicator. (URL)                     |
| **YEAR (CODE)**                    | Code for the year of the indicator. (String)                            |
| **YEAR (DISPLAY)**                 | Display name for the year of the indicator. (String)                    |
| **YEAR (URL)**                     | URL to the year of the indicator. (URL)                                 |
| **REGION (CODE)**                  | Code for the region of the indicator. (String)                          |
| **REGION (DISPLAY)**               | Display name for the region of the indicator. (String)                  |
| **REGION (URL)**                   | URL to the region of the indicator. (URL)                               |
| **WORLDBANKINCOMEGROUP (CODE)**    | Code for the World Bank income group of the indicator. (String)         |
| **STARTYEAR**                      | Start year of the indicator. (Integer)                                  |
| **ENDYEAR**                        | End year of the indicator. (Integer)                                    |
| **WORLDBANKINCOMEGROUP (DISPLAY)** | Display name for the World Bank income group of the indicator. (String) |
| **WORLDBANKINCOMEGROUP (URL)**     | URL to the World Bank income group of the indicator. (URL)              |
| **COUNTRY (CODE)**                 | Code for the country of the indicator. (String)                         |
| **COUNTRY (DISPLAY)**              | Display name for the country of the indicator. (String)                 |
| **COUNTRY (URL)**                  | URL to the country of the indicator. (URL)                              |
| **SEX (CODE)**                     | Code for the sex of the indicator. (String)                             |
| **SEX (DISPLAY)**                  | Display name for the sex of the indicator. (String)                     |
| **SEX (URL)**                      | URL to the sex of the indicator. (URL                                   |

_____

**File: rsud-information-systems-indicators-for-ireland-45.csv**
| Column name                | Description                                                      |
|:---------------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------|
| **GHO (CODE)**             | Global Health Observatory code for the indicator. (String)       |
| **GHO (DISPLAY)**          | Display name for the indicator. (String)                         |
| **GHO (URL)**              | URL to the indicator's metadata. (URL)                           |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (CODE)**    | Code for the publishing state of the indicator. (String)         |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (DISPLAY)** | Display name for the publishing state of the indicator. (String) |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (URL)**     | URL to the publishing state of the indicator. (URL)              |
| **YEAR (CODE)**            | Code for the year of the indicator. (String)                     |
| **YEAR (DISPLAY)**         | Display name for the year of the indicator. (String)             |
| **YEAR (URL)**             | URL to the year of the indicator. (URL)                          |
| **REGION (CODE)**          | Code for the region of the indicator. (String)                   |
| **REGION (DISPLAY)**       | Display name for the region of the indicator. (String)           |
| **REGION (URL)**           | URL to the region of the indicator. (URL)                        |
| **COUNTRY (CODE)**         | Code for the country of the indicator. (String)                  |
| **STARTYEAR**              | Start year of the indicator. (Integer)                           |
| **ENDYEAR**                | End year of the indicator. (Integer)                             |
| **COUNTRY (DISPLAY)**      | Display name for the country of the indicator. (String)          |
| **COUNTRY (URL)**          | URL to the country of the indicator. (URL)                       |
| **Display Value**          | Display value of the indicator. (String)                         |
| **Numeric**                | Numerical value of the indicator. (Integer)                      |
| **Low**                    | Low bound of the indicator. (Integer)                            |
| **High**                   | High bound of the indicator. (Integer)                           |
| **StdErr**                 | Standard error of the indicator. (Integer)                       |
| **StdDev**                 | Standard deviation                                               |

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit [Humanitarian Data Exchange](https://data.world/humdata).
